Section 61 of the Civil Registration Act, 2004 provides for a member of the public to make an application to an tArd-Chláraitheoir to search the indexes to the Births, Deaths and Marriages registers.

Please fill in the above to search civil records

Search results for

Edit Search

Church Records

Access is available to a large volume of pre 20th century records of Baptisms, Marriages and Burials, that in many instances pre-date the Civil Registration. These include:

  • Transcripts of the baptism and marriage records of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Kerry to c. 1900
  • All Roman Catholic baptism, marriage and burial registers for Dublin City
  • All surviving Church of Ireland baptism records
  • Marriage and burial registers for Dublin City

 

Civil Records

Access is available to the General Register Office (GRO) civil records. These include:

  • Birth register records – 1864 to 1924
  • Marriage register records – 1845 to 1949
  • Death register records – 1871 to 1974

Non-Roman Catholic Marriages are recorded from 1845 and Roman Catholic Marriages are recorded from 1864.

Due to data protection, birth records are only accessible when over 100 years old, marriage records are only accessible when over 75 years old and death records are only accessible when over 50 years old. Records are updated every year to include an additional year of records.

Department of Culture, Communications & Sport
Leeson Lane, Co Dublin,
D02 R5Y3

genealogy@tcagsm.gov.ie
